member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch
member.summary: The RecordSearch object enables records to be retrieved by creating a search expression from a number of search methods. The object has methods to allow boolean AND, OR and NOT relationships (these use the 'Reverse Polish' notation), and also the ability to set Record Type filters and sort criteria. RecordSearch instances(Searches) may also be loaded or saved

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.ActivityDueSearchIncludesAuthorization
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter indicating that when searching for %BS_activity% Due, include %bs_activity% requiring authorization

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.ActivityDueSearchIncludesEscalated
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter indicating that when searching for %BS_activity% Due, include escalated %bs_activity%

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.AssigneeSearchIncludesDelegates
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter indicating that when searching by assignee, include delegates for current user

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.AssigneeSearchIncludesGroups
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter indicating that when searching by assignee, include groups for current user

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.AssigneeSearchIncludesPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter indicating that when searching by assignee, include person's position

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.CanEdit
member.summary: Gets a boolean property indicating whether the current user can edit the query

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.CanExecute
member.summary: Gets a boolean property indicating whether the current user can execute the query

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.DefaultIncludesContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean property indicating that when using a default record search, look for matching record document content

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.DefaultIncludesNotes
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean property indicating that when using a default record search, look for matching record notes

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.DefaultIncludesNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean property indicating that when using a default record search, look for matching record numbers

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.DefaultIncludesTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean property indicating that when using a default record search, look for matching record titles

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value that provides a more detailed explanation of when this search should be used

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.FilterString
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value which defines filters for the search.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.FullName
member.summary: Gets the full name of this search (includes any parent search name).

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.IconId
member.summary: Gets or sets an Icons enumeration value to associate a standard Content Manager icon with this saved search.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.IsGrouping
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search is simply a grouping level for a hierarchy, and not actually a search.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.IsOldFormat
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if this search is an old format record search.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.IsPublic
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whethe this search is a search available to all Content Manager users.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.LastUsedOn
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time when this saved serach was last used.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value uniquely identifying this search

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.ObjectType
member.summary: Gets a BaseObjectTypes enum value indicating the type of object this search is designed to retrieve.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.Owner
member.summary: Gets or sets a location value indicating the owner of this search. A null value indicates a public search.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets a SavedSearch to be the parent of this saved search when displaying a hierarchical view of searches

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.QueryString
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value which defines the main criteria search.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.ResultPostProcessing
member.summary: Gets or sets a ResultPostProcessingMethod to apply to the search results

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SavedSearch.SortString
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value which defines the sorting order for the search results.

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.Schedule
member.summary: Defines a set of rules that determine the lifecycle of a set of one or more Records

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.ActionSummary
member.summary: Gets a string describing a summary of the retention management actions of this retention schedule.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.CanAttach
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating if this retention schedule can be attached to a record. Used when defining an intermediate level with the schedule hierarchy.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.CanOnlyDestroyInactive
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether records with this retention schedule can only be disposed if they are not currently active.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.DateSuperseded
member.summary: Gets a datetime indicating when a schedule was superseded.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.ExpandedTitle
member.summary: Gets a string which is an expansion of the schedule title by prepending all higher level schedule titles.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.HasChildSchedules
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if this schedule has any subordinate schedules.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.HasNotes
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether there have been any notes attached to the Schedule.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.IgnoreBlankDestroyTriggers
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether disposal triggers will be ignored if the date calculation results in a blank due date (presumably because a date on the record has not been set)

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.IsAgencySpecific
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether the schedule only applies to the organization that is using Content Manager, or whether it is a schedule published by an archival authority for use across a number of organizations.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the schedule number of this Retention Schedule. This number uniquely identifies this Schedule amongst all other Retention Schedules.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.ParentSchedule
member.summary: Gets the parent schedule which this schedule belongs to, if any.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.PolicyCentreGUID
member.summary: Gets or sets a GUID value indicating the unique identifier for this retention schedule in the Policy Center integration

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.RetainJurisdictions
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value containing a list of jurisdictions which have a retain permanent requirement. Only used if the Retain property is set to KeepForeverInSomeJurisdictions.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.Retention
member.summary: Gets or sets a RetainStyles enumerated value indicating if a retain permanent requirement is in force

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the source from which the Retention Schedule originated, e.g. the archival authority publication number.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.SupersededBy
member.summary: Gets a Schedule object indicating the schedule that supersedes this one.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.SuppressTriggerCalculationAlways
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating if the creation of a retention trigger reindex event should be suppressed whenever an updated is committed to this schedule.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.SuppressTriggerCalculationEventOnCommit
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating if the creation of a retention trigger reindex event should be suppressed when an update is committed. This setting is transient and needs to be specified whenever the schedule is updated.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of this Retention Schedule. This is a brief reference to the subject matter of records this schedule will be applied to.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.UseEarliestDestroyDate
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether the earliest disposal date will be used in a disposition schedule calculation involving multiple destroy triggers (normally the latest destruction date is used).

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.Schedule.ReplaceReferences(TRIM.SDK.Schedule,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replaces all references to this schedule (in records, classifications, record types, origins, check in styles). You can also opt to make the schedule inactive after the references are done and also to keep the existing schedule on records that have been archived or destroyed according this schedule.

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask
member.summary: Describes a computerised task that is to be performed regularly by the Content Manager scheduler

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.Assignee
member.summary: Gets or sets the Location object to whom this Scheduled Task is assigned. This location must perform the Scheduled Task.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.AttachDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date this ScheduledTask object was attached to its record (i.e. the date this Scheduled Task object was created).

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.CompletionDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date this Scheduled Task is due to finish. If this field is left blank, the task will keep repeating forever.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.Description
member.summary: Gets a string containing a description of what is involved in this Scheduled Task. For example, 'Vital Record Review and Update : Record : G05/1'.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.IntervalSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a diDateInterval enum value indicating the type of time interval between repetitions of this Scheduled Task (e.g. Days, Weeks, Months, Years). The size of the interval of this type is specified in the property 'ScheduledTask.IntervalSize'.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.IntervalType
member.summary: Gets or sets a diDateInterval enum value indicating the type of time interval between repetitions of this Scheduled Task (e.g. Days, Weeks, Months, Years). The size of the interval of this type is specified in the property 'ScheduledTask.IntervalSize'.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.IsComplete
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating whether this Scheduled Task has been completed or not.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.LastActionedOn
member.summary: Gets the date this Scheduled Task was last performed. If the Scheduled Task has not yet been performed, this date is blank, meaning the property will return the value 30/12/1899 (d,m,y).

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.NextDueDate
member.summary: Gets the date this Scheduled Task is next due to be performed (i.e. due for its next repetition).

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.Repetitions
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer containing the maximum number of times this Scheduled Task should be repeated.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.RepetitionsDone
member.summary: Gets an integer indicating the number of repetitions of this Scheduled Task that have already been carried out. That is, the number of times this Scheduled Task has been performed since it was started.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.ScheduleDescription
member.summary: Gets a string containing a description of the frequency this Scheduled Task should be performed. Its value is determined by the values of the ScheduledTask.IntervalSize and ScheduledTask.IntervalType properties. For example: 'Perform Scheduled Task every 6 months'.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.StartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date this Scheduled Task is due to start.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.Status
member.summary: Gets a tuTaskStatus enum value indicating whether this Scheduled Task is complete, due or overdue.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTask.ChildHistorys
member.summary: Get the list of Scheduled Task Actions

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTaskHistory
member.summary: Summarises a completed scheduled task for audit purposes

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTaskHistory.ActionDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date the Scheduled Task Action corresponding to this TskHistory object was performed.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTaskHistory.ActionedBy
member.summary: Gets or sets the Location by whom the Scheduled Task Action corresponding to this TskHistory object was performed.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTaskHistory.Details
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the free text field on this TskHistory child object for notes. The TskHistory.SetNotes method may also modify the value of this property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTaskHistory.DueDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date the Scheduled Task Action corresponding to this TskHistory object was due to be performed.

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTaskHistorys
member.summary: A collection of Scheduled Task Actions

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTaskHistorys.getItem(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the item in this child list at the nominated index.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTaskHistorys.New
member.summary: Initialises a new object of this child object collection

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduledTaskHistorys.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent object of this child object collection

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger
member.summary: An individual rule of the parent Schedule that defines circumstances under which a Record should undergo archival/disposal action

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.AfterDays
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer indicating how many months this trigger should wait before initiating the disposition change.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.AfterMonths
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer indicating how many months this trigger should wait before initiating the disposition change. The value of this property must be between 0 and 11. The length of the waiting period is determined by the combination of the SchTrigger.Years property and this property. The wait begins upon a date event determined by the value of the SchTrigger.DateType property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.AfterYears
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer indicating how many years this trigger should wait before initiating the disposition change. The length of the waiting period is determined by the combination of this property and the SchTrigger.Months property. The wait begins upon a date event determined by the value of the SchTrigger.DateType property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.BasedOnEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets an ArchiveEvent object representing an event that will be used to calculate a retention date.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.DateType
member.summary: Gets or sets a tgTriggerTypes enum value indicating a record event upon which the waiting period for this trigger should begin. When the waiting period is over, the record which invoked the trigger is ready to undergo a disposition change according to the type of this trigger.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.DelayType
member.summary: Gets an integer indicating how long after the specified date that this trigger should wait before initiating the disposition change.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.Description
member.summary: Gets a string containing a description of this Trigger. It includes the type of trigger and the date type upon which it is activated, for example: 'Destroy 10 years after Date Inactive'

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.EventOccurringAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets an triggerTypes object representing the date on a record which will be used to find the relevant event occurrence for archiving this record.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.FixedDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the Fixed Trigger Date upon which date the waiting period for this trigger should begin, if it is to begin on a fixed date. This property is only activated when the SchTrigger.DateType property is set to 'tgTriggerTypes.tgFixedDate'.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.IsForDestroy
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating whether this SchTrigger is a destroy trigger

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.Jurisdiction
member.summary: Gets and sets the jurisdiction of this schedule trigger.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.PolicyCentreGUID
member.summary: Gets or sets a GUID value indicating the unique identifier for this retention schedule trigger in the Policy Center integration rule list

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.PolicyCentreMappingGUID
member.summary: Gets or sets a GUID value indicating the unique identifier for this retention schedule trigger in the Policy Center integration rule mapping list

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.PolicyCentreNotes
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value indicating the disposal event/action associated with this retention schedule trigger in the Policy Center integration

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.PolicyCentreTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value indicating the title of this retention schedule trigger in the Policy Center integration

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.Rounding
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount the scheduled date is to be adjusted by rounding up to the end of the appropriate period as indicated in the triggerRounding enumeration.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.TransferTo
member.summary: Gets or sets a Location object that indicates where the new custodian of the records once they have been transferred.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.TriggerType
member.summary: Gets or sets a rdRecordDisp enum value indicating the type of disposition change this trigger should perform. That is, it represents the new disposition a record should acquire after the waiting period triggered by the date event defined in DateType property has been reached.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.TriggerTypeDescription
member.summary: Gets a string containing a summary description of this retention action trigger.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTrigger.UserDefinedDate
member.summary: Gets or sets a FieldDefinition object of type DateTime. The value of this user defined date for records using this trigger's Retention Schedule determines the date the waiting period for the trigger should begin, if it is to begin according to a user defined date. This property is only activated when the SchTrigger.DateType property is set to 'tgTriggerTypes.tgUserDefined'.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTriggers.getItem(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the item in this child list at the nominated index.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTriggers.New
member.summary: Initialises a new object of this child object collection

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.ScheduleTriggers.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent object of this child object collection

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef
member.summary: A helper class that allows you to determine generic capabilities of any of the search clauses defined for selecting TRIM objects in the TRIM object model.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.#ctor(TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseIds,TRIM.SDK.Database)
member.summary: Constructs an SearchClauseDef object based on the specified SearchClauseIds enumeration value. This form of constructor allows you to specify a database which is used to retrieve customised captions.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.Id
member.summary: Gets an integer containing the unique search clause identifier for this search clause definition.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the name for this search clause. The name is used when constructing a search string containing one or more search clauses. Note that to set a name, this search clause must have been constructed with a valid Database parameter. To make name changes permanent, call the SaveCaptionChanges method of the database

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.Icon
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the TRIM icon associated with this search clause.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.InternalName
member.summary: Gets a string containing the internal name for this search clause. It will be the same as the Name property unless there has been a customisation done for this database.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.Caption
member.summary: Gets or sets a caption for this search clause. This is usually the caption for the associated property, where the clause is based on that property. In other cases, this is a short but more user friendly name for the search clause.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.GetTooltip(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a string containing a tool tip for this search clause.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.GetParametersTooltip(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a string containing a tool tip about the parameters required for this search clause.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.CanSort(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search clause can be used a sort criteria for searching for the specified object type.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.GetSortTooltip(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a string containing a tool tip when using this search clause for sorting.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.IsRelevantForType(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search clause is relevant for the nominated type of TRIM object.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.IsAvailableForType(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search clause is available for the nominated type of TRIM object. If the function returns false, the ErrorMessage property will contain an informational message indicating why the search method is unavailable.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.IsActivatedForType(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search clause is available for the nominated type of TRIM object. It also checks if it is linked to a product feature and whether that product feature is activated. If the function returns false, the ErrorMessage property will contain an informational message indicating why the search method is unavailable.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.OnlyForType
member.summary: Gets a BaseObjectTypes enumeration value indicating the specific object type this search clause belongs to. If the search clause is a generic one (i.e. it applies to more than one object type), a value of Unknown will be returned.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.BasedOnProperty
member.summary: Gets a PropertyIds enumeration value indicating the object property that is associated with this search clause. Many search clauses are simply based on selecting a value for a particular property, some are not specifically associated with a property (in which case the Unknown value will be returned.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.MethodGroup
member.summary: Gets a SearchClauseGroup enumeration value indicating the particlar group of search clauses that this clause belongs to. Search clauses grouped in this way to aid in presentation, in some cases.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.ParameterFormat
member.summary: Gets a PropertyFormats enumeration value indicating the format of the data value that needs to be provided when using this search clause for searching. (Note. This property will soon be obsolete, use the SearchParameterFormat instead).

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.SearchParameterFormat
member.summary: Gets a SearchParameterFormats enumeration value indicating the format of the data value that needs to be provided when using this search clause for searching.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.GetObjectTypeParameter(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a BaseObjectTypes enumeration value indicating the type of object that needs to be supplied as a data value when search by this search clause. Is only relevant when the ParameterFormat is of type Object.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.GetEnumTypeParameter
member.summary: Gets an AllEnumerations enumeration value indicating the TRIM enum that is associated with a search is being made by this search clause. Is only relevant when the ParameterFormat is of type Enum.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.NeedsAccessControlTypeParameter
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search clause needs the additional AccessControlType parameter.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.NeedsSubQueryObjectTypeParameter
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search clause needs the additional SubQueryObjectType parameter.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.NeedsRelationshipTypeParameter
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search clause needs the additional SubQueryRelationshipType parameter.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.IsBlocked(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search clause has been blocked by the administrator for the current user

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.FindSearchClauseIdFromString(System.String,TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes,TRIM.SDK.Database)
member.summary: Gets an SearchClauseIds enumeration value from a search string name. Returns Unknown if there is no matching search clause available for the nominated TRIM object type. This form also allows you to supply a Database in order that any customised search strings will be examined.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef.GetAllSearchClauseIds(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes,TRIM.SDK.Database)
member.summary: Constructs an array of all SearchClauseIds for the nominated object type.

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef
member.summary: The SearchClauseOrFieldDef class provides a generic abstraction of TRIM search clauses user-defined fields.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a SearchClauseOrFieldDef that encapsulates a standard search clause definition.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.#ctor(TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseIds)
member.summary: Construct a SearchClauseOrFieldDef that encapsulates a standard search clause definition. The database parameter allows the item access to any customized captions.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.#ctor(TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseIds,TRIM.SDK.Database)
member.summary: Construct a SearchClauseOrFieldDef that encapsulates a standard search clause definition.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.#ctor(TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseDef)
member.summary: Construct a SearchClauseOrFieldDef that encapsulates a FieldDefinition object.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.IsASearchClause
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this object represents a standard search clause definition (as opposed to a field).

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.IsAField
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating whether this object represents a user field (as opposed to a standard search clause definition).

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.ClauseId
member.summary: Gets a SearchClauseIds enumeration value containing the SearchClauseId associated with this object, if it is a standard search clause definition.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.ClauseDef
member.summary: Gets the SearchClauseDef object associated with this SearchClauseOrFieldDef, if it is a standard search clause definition.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.FieldUri
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the FieldDefinition associated with this object, if it is a user field.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.Field
member.summary: Gets or sets the FieldDefinition object associated with this SearchClauseOrFieldDef, it if is a user field

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.SearchParameterFormat
member.summary: Gets a SearchParameterFormats enum value indicating the generic format of this search method .

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.MethodGroup
member.summary: Gets a SearchClauseGroup enumeration value indicating the particular group of search clauses that this method belongs to. Search methods grouped in this way to aid in presentation, in some cases.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.ClauseName
member.summary: Gets a short format search method name that can be used in the string searching syntax

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.IsAvailableForType(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search method is available for the nominated type of TRIM object. If the function returns false, the ErrorMessage property will contain an informational message indicating why the search method is unavailable.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.IsActivatedForType(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search method is available for the nominated type of TRIM object. It also checks if it is linked to a product feature and whether that product feature is activated. If the function returns false, the ErrorMessage property will contain an informational message indicating why the search method is unavailable.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.GetTooltip(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a string containing a tool tip for this search clause.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.GetParametersTooltip(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a string containing a tool tip about the parameters required for this search clause.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.CanSort(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this search clause can be used a sort criteria for searching for the specified object type.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.GetSortTooltip(TRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a string containing a tool tip when using this search clause for sorting.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SearchClauseOrFieldDef.Caption
member.summary: Gets the caption corresponding to this property or field.

member.summary: Compares two ApiSearchClauseOrFieldDef objects, using the caption as a sort sequence

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.SecurityCaveat
member.summary: A privacy control allowing Records to be marked as requiring users to ave the corresponding control before being given access

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityCaveat.Abbreviation
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the abbreviation for this Security Caveat (for example, SiC for Staff in Confidence)

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityCaveat.CaveatNumber
member.summary: Gets a unique number identifying this security caveat. This number is allocated automatically when a new security caveat is created and is used internally as part of the security filtering algorithm.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityCaveat.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing a description of this Security Caveat.

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.SecurityGuide
member.summary: Describes standard security settings which can be used in specialised security scenarios

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityGuide.Declassify
member.summary: Gets a string containing details of the declassification process for records using this Security Guide Entry. These details are determined by the value of the SecurityGuide.DeclassifyType property and the relevant values of the DeclassifyEvent, DeclassifyYears, DeclassifyExemption or DeclassifyDate properties.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityGuide.DeclassifyDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date upon which records using this Security Guide Entry should be declassified. The SecurityGuide.DeclassifyType must be set to 'DeclassifyType.Exempt' to activate this property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityGuide.DeclassifyEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing a description of the event upon which records using this Security Guide Entry should be declassified. The SecurityGuide.DeclassifyType must be set to 'DeclassifyType.AfterEvent' to activate this property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityGuide.DeclassifyExemption
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the reason for this record to be exempt from declassification. The SecurityGuide.DeclassifyType must be set to 'DeclassifyType.AfterDate' to activate this property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityGuide.DeclassifyYears
member.summary: Gets or sets a number indicating the number of years after publication that records using this Security Guide Entry should be declassified. The SecurityGuide.DeclassifyType must be set to 'DeclassifyType.AfterDate' to activate this property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityGuide.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing a description for this Security Guide Entry.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityGuide.EntryReference
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the reference number identifying the Security Guide Entry corresponding to this SecurityGuide object.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityGuide.Reason
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the reason for applying this Security Guide Entry to a record.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityGuide.SecurityString
member.summary: Gets or sets a string listing the security level and security caveats assigned to this Security Guide, delimited by commas ','. The first element listed is always the security level, followed by the caveats.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityGuide.TypeOfDeclassification
member.summary: Gets or sets a DeclassifyType enum value indicating the type of declassification that should occur to records using this Security Guide Entry. The values are 'dcExempt' for which the record should be exempt from declassification (the reason for this held in the DeclassifyExemption property); 'dcAfterDate' for which the record should be declassified after a specified date or a specified number of years after publication (the date for this held in the DeclassifyDate property, or number of years in the DeclassifyYears property); or 'dcAfterEvent' for which the record should be declassified after a specified event (details of the specific event held in the DeclassifyEvent property)

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.SecurityLevel
member.summary: A hierarchical security indicator that can be associated with Records and Locations to determine access rights

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityLevel.Abbreviation
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the abbreviation for this Security Level (for example, TS for Top Secret).

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityLevel.LevelNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique number indicating the ranking of this Security Level. This number must be in the range 1 to 99, and establishes the order of precedence.A greater number represents a higher Security Level.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.SecurityLevel.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing a description of the Security Level.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SecurityLevel.DeleteEx(TRIM.SDK.SecurityLevel)
member.summary: If you specify a NULL replacement parameter, all items using this security level will be set to 0 (lowest security level).

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.SharePointItem.Relocate
member.summary: Relocate is a method you can use to transfer the item from SharePoint to Content Manager. Relocate will extract the document from SharePoint and copy it to CM, then remove the links back into SharePoint. This SharePointItemobject will effectively be removed after a relocate

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.Space
member.summary: Represents a location for long term archival storage of physical records, typically within a warehouse

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.AdministeredBy
member.summary: Gets a location object representing the administrator for this space - either specifically assigned one or the first adminstrator defined up the hierarchy

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.Administrator
member.summary: Gets a location object representing the administrator that has been assigned specifically for this space

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.AdvancedUsageDetails
member.summary: Gets a string containing a description of the usage of this space. Includes advanced calculations.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.Available
member.summary: Gets a number indicating the number of records that may still be added to this space (including lower level spaces) before it reaches its total capacity. The total capacity of this space is held in the Space.Capacity property. The total number of records that are already stored in this space and its lower level spaces is held in the Space.Used property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.Barcode
member.summary: Gets a string containing the internal Content Manager barcode for this space.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.Capacity
member.summary: Gets or sets a number indicating the total capacity of this space level. That is, the total number of records that can be stored within this space including all spaces within this selected space level. The number of records that are already stored in this space is held in the Space.Used property. The number of records that may still be added to this space is held in the Space.Available property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.Description
member.summary: Gets a string containing a description of this Space object, which consists of its Level Name and Number. For example, 'Area 1' or 'Slot 4'.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.DestroyedAllBays
member.summary: Gets an integer indicating how many records from all holding bays within this selected space level have been destroyed. That is, the number of records with the holding bay of this space or any of its lower levels as home location that have a disposition of 'Destroyed'.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.DestroyedInBay
member.summary: Gets a number indicating how many records within the holding bay for this space have been destroyed. That is, the number of records with the holding bay of this space as home location that have a disposition of 'Destroyed'.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.DestroyedRecords
member.summary: Gets a number indicating how many records within this space have been destroyed. That is, the number of records with this space as home location that have a disposition of 'Destroyed'.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.ForeignBarcode
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing an external organization's barcodes for this Space. This property may be used in conjunction with a barcode scanner in 'Set Home Location' mode to transfer records into this storage location. For multiple barcodes, separate each with a semi-colon. No barcode can be longer than 30 characters.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.FullDescription
member.summary: Gets a string containing a full description of this space, including the hierarchy it belongs to. For example, 'Warehouse 1, Floor 3, Bay 7.'

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.HasHoldingBay
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether this space has a holding bay. A holding bay is a temporary storage place where records may be held until they are ready to be transferred.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.IsCaptioned
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating whether this level has been captioned. That is, if the title of this level has been customized by the user. Use the Content Manager client interface to change the level captions.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.IsLowestLevel
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating whether this space is the lowest level in the Space System. If it is the lowest level, it will not contain any spaces. Use the Space.CreateLowerLevels method to create new lower levels for this Space.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.Level
member.summary: Gets a slSpaceLevel enum value indicating the level name of this space. The values are: Warehouse, Floor, Area, Bay, Row, Shelf, Slot.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.NickName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the unique name for this Space object. This is the Quick Search Key by which this space may be identified in a Content Manager search. It is left empty by default.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.NodeAvailable
member.summary: Gets a number indicating the number of records that may still be added to this space (including lower level spaces) before it reaches its total capacity. The total capacity of this space is held in the Space.Capacity property. The total number of records that are already stored in this space and its lower level spaces is held in the Space.Used property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.NodeCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets a number indicating the total capacity of this space level. That is, the total number of records that can be stored within this space including all spaces within this selected space level. The number of records that are already stored in this space is held in the Space.Used property. The number of records that may still be added to this space is held in the Space.Available property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.NodeUsed
member.summary: Gets a number indicating the number of records that are currently stored in this space including all spaces within this selected space level. The number of records that may still be added to this space is held in the Space.Available property. The total capacity of this space is held in the Space.Capacity property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.Number
member.summary: Gets a string containing the number of this space. The number differentiates this space from the other spaces of the same level which are contained within the same parent space. By default the first new lower level created will have a value of 0001, unless the numbering is started at a different value at the time of lower level creation. For example, the 1st row of the 3rd area of the 2nd Warehouse created will have a default number of '0002-0003-0001'.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsActualAllBays
member.summary: Gets a number indicating how many records are actually in any holding bays within this selected space level. That is, the number of records with the holding bay for this space or any of its lower levels as home location which are currently assigned to the holding bay.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsActuallyAtHome
member.summary: Gets an integer indicating how many records are actually at home. That is, the number of records with this Space as their home location which are currently assigned to this space.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsActuallyInBay
member.summary: Gets an integer indicating how many records are actually in the holding bay for this space. That is, the number of records with the holding bay for this space as home location which are currently assigned to the holding bay.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsAdded2YearsAgo
member.summary: Gets a number indicating how many records were added to this space during the calendar year previous to last year (i.e. two years ago).

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsAddedLastYear
member.summary: Gets a number indicating how many records were added to this space within the previous calendar year.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsAddedThisYear
member.summary: Gets a number indicating how many records have been added to this space since the beginning of this year.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsAllBays
member.summary: Gets a number indicating how many records are stored in all holding bays within this selected level. That is, the number of records with the holding bay for this space or any of its lower levels as home location.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsAtHome
member.summary: Gets an integer indicating how many records have this Space object as home location.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsInHoldingBay
member.summary: Gets an integer indicating how many records have the holding bay for this space as home location. A holding bay is a temporary storage place where records may be held until they are ready to be transferred. This space has a holding bay if the Space.HasHoldingBay property is set to true.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsLoanAllBays
member.summary: Gets a number indicating how many records are on loan from all holding bays within this selected space level. That is, the number of records with the holding bay for this space or any of its lower levels as home location which are not currently assigned to the holding bay.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsOut
member.summary: Gets a number indicating how many records are currently out on loan. That is, the number of records with this Space as their home location which are currently not assigned to this space.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.RecordsOutOfBay
member.summary: Gets a number indicating how many records belonging in the holding bay for this space are out on loan. That is, the number of records with the holding bay for this space as home location which are not currently assigned to the holding bay.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.UsageDetails
member.summary: Gets a string containing a description of the usage of this space. This includes information about the total capacity of this space, remaining capacity available, total records allocated, and records allocated to a holding bay.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.Used
member.summary: Gets a number indicating the number of records that are currently stored in this space including all spaces within this selected space level. The number of records that may still be added to this space is held in the Space.Available property. The total capacity of this space is held in the Space.Capacity property.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.Space.Within
member.summary: Gets the Space object which is the parent level within which this space is contained. If this space is a top-level space, a null value will be returned.

member.name: F:TRIM.SDK.SpaceAllocation.Contiguous
member.summary: To contiguous set of lowest level Spaces

member.name: F:TRIM.SDK.SpaceRecordsSelection.InBay
member.summary: All Records in the Holding Bay for this Space

member.name: F:TRIM.SDK.SpaceRecordsSelection.InSpaceRecursive
member.summary: All Records in lowest level Spaces of this Space

member.name: F:TRIM.SDK.SpaceRecordsSelection.InBayRecursive
member.summary: All Records in the Holding Bays for this Space and any lower level Holding Bays

member.name: F:TRIM.SDK.SpaceRecordsSelection.InEitherRecursive
member.summary: All Records in this Space and any lower levels (including Holding Bays)

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList
member.summary: The TrimAccessControlList class is used to encapsulate the access controls that can be applied to an object an access control list consists of an array of entries that control who has access to a particular restricted function. These restricted functions may differ depending upon which object the access control list applies to, for example a meeting object may wish to restrict who can 'Take Minutes'. Each object that support access control lists will have an enum describing its set of restricted functions - in this class, the elements of this enum are simple defined as an int.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.GetAccessAllowed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the currently logged in user is provided access to the specified function.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.GetAccessAllowedForUser(System.Int32,TRIM.SDK.Location)
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the given user is provided access to the specified function.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.GetAsString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a string containing a description of the nominated access control for this object. The string consists of a list of location names for this Access Control, delimited by semicolons.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.get_AccessLocations(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of locations that should be given access to the specified function. When updating the list, if the new list is empty or null, access to that function will revert to 'Everyone' or 'Public', otherwise the current user list will be replaced.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAccessLocationsOrContainer(System.Int32,TRIM.SDK.LocationList)
member.summary: A special function that will set access to the specified function to the nominated set of locations, however will also include any locations in the corresponding access control of the container to be included.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetPrivate(System.Int32,TRIM.SDK.Location)
member.summary: Sets the access control for the nominated function to be a single location.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetPrivateOrContainer(System.Int32,TRIM.SDK.Location)
member.summary: A special function that will set access to the specified function to the nominated location, however will also include any locations in the corresponding access control of the container to be included.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetInherited(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the access control for the nominated function to be inherited from the record's container

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetPublic(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the access control for the nominated function to be public

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.get_CurrentSetting(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets an AccessControlSettings enum value indicating whether the Access Control is Inherited, Private (Custom) or Public. Note that the Inherited value only applied to record, indicating that the record's access control is based on the record's container. If you change this value to 'Private', it will be made private to the currently logged in user

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.get_ReferenceStyle(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets an AccessReferenceStyle enum value indicating how this access control list is is to be applied to the target object which it will be copied to. Reference style only applies to access controls that are to be copied, i.e. the default record access control that is defined for a record type. Check the IsCopied property to see if this is applicable.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAllInherited
member.summary: Allows you to set all the access controls to be based on the record's container

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAllPrivate(TRIM.SDK.LocationList)
member.summary: Allows you to set all the access controls to the nominated list of locations

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAllPrivate(TRIM.SDK.Location)
member.summary: Allows you to set all the access controls to the nominated single location

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAllPrivate
member.summary: Allows you to set all the access controls to the current user

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAllPublic
member.summary: Allows you to set all the access controls to the 'Public'/'Everyone' same setting.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.FunctionEnum
member.summary: Gets the enumeration which lists the functions that are applicable for this access control list.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.IsCopied
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if this access control list is one that is a copy default list.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.IsModified
member.summary: Gets a boolean parameter indicating if any changes have been made to this access control list since it was first constructed.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAggregateResultIterator.Current
member.summary: Returns the current aggregate result where this iterator is position. You need to have got a successful result from the most recent MoveNext() or MoveToStart() before calling this.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAggregateResultIterator.MoveNext
member.summary: Moves the iterator forward through the result set.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAggregateResultIterator.Reset
member.summary: Resets the iterator back to the initial state

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAggregateResultIterator.Reset(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resets the iterator back to the initial state, however you can optionally work with the current aggregated query results

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimAggregateResultIterator.KeyCount
member.summary: gets the number of distinct key values in the selection, which also corresponds to the number of items the iterator will return.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimAggregateResultIterator.TotalHits
member.summary: gets the total of all the counts for the different key values returned by this iterator.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimAggregateResultIterator.RemovedKeyCount
member.summary: gets the number of distinct key values that were removed from the selection because of the limitation imposed by the MaxKeyValues setting. These key values are aggregated into the the result called "Other".

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAggregateResultIterator.ShowResultsForKey(System.String)
member.summary: gets a TrimMainObjectSearch that shows all the results for a single key value.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimAggregateResultIterator.ShowResultsForManyKeys(TRIM.SDK.StringArray)
member.summary: gets a TrimMainObjectSearch that shows all the results for one or more key values.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimAggregateResultIterator.MaxKeyValues
member.summary: This method allows you to remove any results which have a low number of hits by restricting the list to a maximum number of items. Using this method you can then display only the most relevant key values (i.e. those with a higher number of hits) and group the remainder into a section called "other". The function returns a count of the total number of hits removed. Will automatically reset the iterator.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimAggregateResultIterator.AggregateBy
member.summary: gets or sets a ApiPropertyOrFieldDef object to indicate the property that is being used for the aggregation.

member.name: T:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.RuntimeEnvironment

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.ServiceType

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.setAsService
member.summary: Notifies the SDK that this application is running as a Windows service. Can only be called once in your application.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.SetAsWebService(System.String)
member.summary: Notifies the SDK that this application is running as a Web Service. Can only be called once in your application. To run as a web service, you must specify a path for storing temporary per-user work files. If the path parameter is left blank or NULL, TRIM will consult the local machine registry to see if a web service path has been defined there.

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.BinaryPath
member.summary: Returns the name of the Windows folder where the Content Manager software is installed

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.TemporaryPath

member.summary: Gets the name of the TRIM help file for the nominated language

member.name: P:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.HasUserInterface
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating if the running application has access to a user interface.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.ProcessMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Processes the specified string, replacing any special TRIM substitution string (e.g. %B_record%, %E_tt_Favorites%, etc)

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.ProcessMessage(TRIM.SDK.Database,System.String)
member.summary: Processes the specified string, replacing any special TRIM substitution string (e.g. %B_record%, %E_tt_Favorites%, etc). The supplied database parameter allows any local customized captions to be used instead of standard TRIM captions.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.IsLanguageSupported(System.Int16)
member.summary: Indicates if the current installation of Content Manager has a localization available for the nominated language

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.SetDefaultLanguage(System.Int16)
member.summary: Sets the current thread default language to be used for subsequent calls to GetMessage and any other functions that are language specific. Note that this default will not be used if a connected Database object is provided. The function returns false if the specified language is not supported. The language is specified using the standard Windows Language Identifier.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.IsLanguageSupported(TRIM.SDK.Language)
member.summary: Indicates if the current installation of Content Manager has a localization available for the nominated language

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.SetDefaultLanguage(TRIM.SDK.Language)
member.summary: Sets the current thread default language to be used for subsequent calls to GetMessage and any other functions that are language specific. Note that this default will not be used if a connected Database object is provided. The function returns false if the specified language is not supported. The language is specified using using the TRIM enumeration for currently supported TRIM languages.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.GetDatabaseIds(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a list of database ids that are supported by a particular workgroup server. Note that the returned set of database ids are not authenticated, it is possible that the current user may not have access to some or all of them.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.GetTimeZones
member.summary: Gets the list of windows time zone display strings.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.MIMETypeToFileType(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a MIME type to a Windows File Type extension string, according to the list of known file types used by Content Manager.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.InitializeIconCache(TRIM.SDK.Database,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the icon cache for this application. This will basically download and synchronize any external icons. Set useAuthoringAppIconsIfAvailable to true, to enable loading of icons from locally installed authoring applications (such as Microsoft Office).

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.PreloadIconsAsPNG(TRIM.SDK.IconSizes)
member.summary: This will pre-load the icon cache with all icons converted to PNG format. It will synchronize to ensure that the latest versions of the icons are in the cache. You will need to call this for each size of PNG file that you wish to pre-load. Note that other sizes will be loaded on demand when using the GetIconAsPNG function.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.PreloadIconsAsICO
member.summary: This will pre-load the icon cache with all icons converted to ICO format. It will synchronize to ensure that the latest versions of the icons are in the cache.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.GetIconAsPNG(TRIM.SDK.TrimIcon,TRIM.SDK.IconSizes)
member.summary: Converts a TrimIcon to PNG file of the specified size. It first looks in the standard icon cache folder to see if a PNG already exists, otherwise it will attempt to download it. To ensure that any external icons are available, you should first call the InitIconCache function.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.GetIconAsICO(TRIM.SDK.TrimIcon)
member.summary: Converts a TrimIcon to ICO file. It first looks in the standard icon cache folder to see if a ICO already exists, otherwise it will attempt to download it. To ensure that any external icons are available, you should first call the InitializeIconCache function.

member.name: M:TRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.GetIconCacheFolder
member.summary: Gets the folder that is used for storing external icons files and any icons that have been requested as PNG files.
